bullets.text: Fed minutes show a tight split over the December rate cut; officials stressed data-dependence and balancing inflation risks against slowing growth.
Regulators updated Community Reinvestment Act asset-size thresholds, shifting which banks face simplified vs. expanded compliance requirements.
U.S.-Ukraine ties appear to be fraying, raising uncertainty for military aid and altering Europe’s security calculations as Russia pressures Kyiv.
Reported CIA strike in Venezuela signals higher U.S.-Venezuela confrontation risk and potential spillovers to energy markets and regional stability.
U.S. sanctions targeting Iranian and Venezuelan networks tied to weapons trade widen financial restrictions and raise enforcement risk for cross-border intermediaries.
New Israeli rules could suspend Gaza aid groups, potentially reducing humanitarian flows and increasing diplomatic pressure amid ongoing conflict.
Iran’s currency crash and inflation are driving protests into universities, highlighting domestic instability risks amid sanctions and economic strain.
SoftBank reportedly fully funded a $40B OpenAI investment, underscoring escalating capital needs for frontier AI and intensifying competitive spending.
Meta’s acquisition of AI agent firm Manus extends Big Tech’s race for autonomous-agent capabilities and may accelerate consolidation in the AI tooling market.
OpenAI’s cash burn is flagged as a key 2026 bubble risk, focusing investors on unit economics, infrastructure costs, and sustainable revenue growth.
Copper is on pace for its best year since 2009, driven by AI/electrification demand and supply fears—supporting capex and inflation sensitivity via metals.
China’s EV sector in 2026 may shift from boom to survival as price wars and global expansion intensify, pressuring margins across automakers and suppliers.
Cheap solar is reshaping African households and businesses, lowering energy costs and enabling new economic activity—often via Chinese hardware supply chains.
